description: Set it up by transferring all relevant info from my spreadsheet, and configuring it to my needs. It is working well. I now download income, expenses and tax data to further process in my spreadsheet as a back end. For instance, projections, budget planning, investment decisions. The one thing that is not working is Yahoo JSON to obtain securities quotes, but not the fault of GnuCash, but Yahoo blocking it. I can, however, export those from my spreadsheet and have GC import them. And presto, I have a fully functional and effective personal accounting system. Thanks!
Just working. love it

I have used GnuCash to handle economy for three years and I'm very happy about the reliability and features of this software. It could use a modernization though. But I love how I can use it to visualize an economy with graphs and PDF reports.
I have this software for more than 3 years, and it works nicely.
Great software! Not always intuitive, I use it to manage small business.

From business to personal, everything is possible with this app!
Love it! It finally has a Russian Rubles sign!
summary: Great tool for wide spectrum of users

description: Is this app has a mobile phone version. Such as for android. And will that sync with this desktop one.
summary: Not a review. Just a question

description: Use it all the time for personal financial tracking and planning! Lots of features, so I use only those valuable to me and all the other features don't get in my way!

Initial account setup is difficult and documentation is not the best. Integrates well with the phone app. 
Once you are used to the program you will be balancing your yearly accounts to within cents.

Works greate. Good import possibilities from csv data. A little to much hands on, but as there are no conventions on the bank data this is the best way.
Like it a lot and gave me great overview over my private expenses.

Not easy but it is worth it.
Simply, it is not made for someone with average financial skills. Went to the help, not written so it can be understood by the normal person.
As a sole-trader in the UK I find GNUCash does the job but it's not easy to use. I can't even work out how to add my bank details to an invoice.
summary: OK but not easy to use

description:
recommended
lve it

Let's be clear - this is not easy software to use. You will need to learn how to use it. 

However, once you understand how to use it to its potential, you can't imagine living without it.
summary: Power software for the power user

description: I love GNUCash for meeting my small (one-person) accounting needs. The learning curve can be difficult, but the program is well documented online. I just wish the Ubuntu Store would actually update their download of it, since it is stuck at 2.6.19 and they're (at the time of the review) on 3.6
summary: Excellent when learned. Hasn't been update on store

description: have moved to it since 2006 and never looked back - consider using qifqif for a better imports of qif files
summary: is FREE and has a solid userbase

description: Install aborted due to unmet dependencies which were supposed to be listed but wasn't.
...but useful for anyone seeking to keep an overview of your personal expenses. Absolutely fantastic!
summary: Great not only for small businesses..

description:
I've used GNUCash for a long time now. I'm not much into this but I run a small LLC. Since my accounts are central, I find this system very handy.

If however you have to use it in a multi-user environment, this is not suitable as you can simply click and change a value. I mean, it provides lesser control features.

But for me, it's simple and straightforward. I think the Open source community should help take this software forward.
summary: One of the most straightforward tools you could find for accounts

description: It does the job of tracking expenses but you have better cash management tools on your smart phone these days.

This is an excellent program. The manual is very comprehensive, and it even gives you lessons about basic accounting. As a non accountant I find this software excellent. It takes a bit of time to master, but is far easier than most other accounting packages. This is simply a case of "Read the friendly manual", and you will be using it in no time!

Although this is a good app, the version you can find on Ubuntu Software Center is from more than 1 year ago and does not provide the features introduced with v3.7 (latest at the time of writing). If you know what you are doing, compile from source (plenty of tutorials out there). Anyway some GUI bugs here and there but still ok. Recommended.
There is a new version - Gnucash 3.8 with a lot of bugs fixed, but it is still not available here. :-(
Although the display of this app is a bit dated, it is exactly what I hoped it would be. Formerly used Mint to track my finances. This app works perfectly for helping me track my finances.
I've used this for quite a few years.  I imagine for most people it would be a bit of a learning curve, but for my basic ledger use and my background, it's not bad at all.
Have used this software for 12 years to run both my business and personal finance. Love it!!

As a double-entry booking system, this is fantastic to work with. It is *very* well documented and you can learn from a beginner level if you take the time to read. This has everything I wanted to do business and personal accounting. Easy to import data from banks and other software and easy to backup the accounts as well.

I've been using GNUCash for years and never had a problem with it. There's a bit to learn, but if you start simple you should be able to figure it out as you go. Remember, you add accounts (ie: Expenses account > Car account > Petrol account) instead of categories and transfer the money from your current account into them to register a payment. It's also very easy to save your file in dropbox so you can access it on multiple computers.
Warning....if you learn it ...you'll never be able to live without.

I can't understand the low ratings for this excellent software. Yes, you do need to know about double entry bookkeeping, you do need to be aware of layouts of financial reports....just as you would with any accounts package. As a free offering it excels...It is flexible and can adjust to all national codes...it is very stable....it is professional grade software.
I will tell you how it is after use

I am using Gnucash for my personal financing, it has all bells and whisles, and more if you are willing to learn (you need to manage debit/credit and assets/liabilities for all your transactions though). You can easily import CSV files from your bank statements and petty cash, so it is partly automated. I wish there were more frequent updates.

Not for a casual user.

However, double entry bookkeeping is an incredible invention of humankind, and if you truly want to understand what is going on with your money, there is no substitute for double entry bookkeeping. I recommend everyone learn this and use it to take control of your finances and therefore your life.

But if you want something quick and easy, go to the competition- there are ton of online providers and free or cheap easy to use software from huge companies that are harvesting your data.

This software does double entry bookkeeping very well. The UI seems hard to use at first but rapidly becomes intuitive. GNU cash faithfully produces financial statements, handles stock & bond investment, tracks dividends, interest paid and collected, expenses, hierarchies of accounts, stock splits, stock quotes and much more than I could list in this brief review.

I only gave it four stars because I am having some difficulty upgrading versions and the package in my ubuntu software store seems out of date.
summary: Best of the best free software

description:
I have Gnu Cash to manage my stocks income on the share market and my personal account
It is has excellent reporting capability. Can even make custom reprot (which i haven't tested).
You can do split transactions and shcedule transactions.
It is biased to the american taxation system.
If you do not understand how to do accounting you may find somethinfs confusing.
Otherise I reccommend this app 100%.
p.s. Re "my stocks" you do NOT technical analysis and stock charting. Not the intention.

I never went to college, I'm not an accountant. I need to boot strap my accounting and felt paying a subscription to quick book sucks. So I did a little reading on double line acounting and found Gnu Cash is awesome for what I do. Billing, Invoices etc. Best FOSS accounting software out there.

Real double-entry book-keeping. I don't use many of the 
more-complex features, but quit happy with the 
record-keeping and reporting features. I would *like* a better
option to close out a year and start a new one...

Not as user-friendly as Quicken but if you take an entry level accounting class or read Accounting for Dummies, you'll be fine. This is actually a very powerful and versitile program you can use for personal budgeting, or running a small business.

I used gnuCash for several years on ubuntu and windows, and everything wasgreat. I tried to install it, and it said it did, but I can find it (no icon). Decide to remove it, and it responded that it did not have a removal feature. Since I have no idea what happended and can not reverse what it did, I would avoid this software.
summary: What has gone wrong with this application

description: Download never completed, let alone installation of software and actual use.

This program is not for the drive-by user. As others have mentioned, in order to utilize this software well you will need to learn some principles of double-entry accounting, such as assets, liabilities, equity, debits & credits, and so on. That being said, from tracking home finances up through tracking business revenue and expenses, there is simply no other free software out there which does what gnucash does well. The time you spend learning and setting up your financial structure here will pay educational dividends through the rest of your life. In addition, the data storage options (xml or database) provided by this program are widely supported and will easily mesh with other data interaction tools (programming languages like python / java, web server frameworks, purpose built tools, and so on).
summary: The Best Free Accounting Software Available

description: very usefully

It's easy to manage my household finances and investment accounts and find I prefer this over the commercial options. The commercial products that I used to use would always disable themselves when the publisher wanted to squeeze my wallet for more money. :( I'm no longer a hostage 

The only complaint I have is that report customization requires that I learn to code in Scheme, Guile and Gettext... none of which I'm familiar with. I've found the rest of the application is easy to learn and use via the GUI.
summary: This beats all the closed source options I used in the past

description: Takes some exporing, but very good

I installed the software, added an account, and could never find where to edit the opening balance of the account. When I attempted to launch Help, it crashed. I'm sure it's useful for some people, and obviously a lot of work was put into it, but you should consider your users when making software. A program that has every bell and whistle is useless if you can't find what you need.
Running a small business for several years using GnuCash. Takes a bit to learn if new to accounting software.

I last updated quicken to 2015. It did all I need and I could not see paying for annual license when quicken changed to that option in 2018. My hard drive crashed and after replacing it I found there was no way I could recover my quicken program. I had purchased the digital copy and assumed (you know what that means) that they would keep a copy available for such situations. As you can guess, they did not and would be more than happy to sell me the annual subscription. I decided to try gnucash and AM GLAD THAT I did. It does most of the things quicken would do AND I can use it on my linux box, my PC or my Android tablet. Quicken could not do that.

I'm probably into my 10th year or so of using gnucash and it has never let me down. I used to run Sage but it was very expensive and no better for a small to medium business. It does take a bit of learning but so long as you remember the double entry principle you can work very simply.

There are a number of 'Chart of Accounts' to choose from to start with. Once started you can add or delete accounts at will. You can generate invoices and reports, all from a prescribed format or make up your own format.

The help is brilliant and starts at a very simple concept level, this example taken from help and the 5 basic accounts.

ACCOUNT TYPES
Assets
  Things you own
Liabilities
  Things you owe
Equity
  Overall net worth
Income
  Increases the value of your accounts
Expenses
  Decreases the value of your accounts

....and you are not being stung everytime it is upgraded.
Super easy and Awsome

I've been using this app for many years without problems. It's geared for business primarily. But if you know basic accounting principles you can use this app very usefuly for personal or home accounting. 
If you are looking for something similar to quicken I recommend KMymoney which uses the cheque book approach.
summary: Great app if you know basic accounting

description: Here's the thing...A typical home user DOES NOT NEED DOUBLE ENTRY ACCOUNTING, and that's what makes most accounting apps too complicated. We need to know what's coming in and what's going out. It does not need to "balance".  I've been looking for an app to replace one that i wrote in Access95 20 years ago which does everything i want, but needs an XP VM which is not ideal . My homegrown app imports, automatically categorises, can split transactions and monitor my investments using mutiple currencies. It even lets me link documents to transactions. It is NOT acccounting software in the true sense of the word, but it's what i need. Why can't someone write something similar?
Been using gnucash for almost 10 years now. Great app, but it's so out of date in the repo. Version 4.8 is now avaialble but we are still on 3.8. Do something!
summary: Great app but so-o-o-o out of date

description:
The packaged version is 3.8 but github has 4.8
it works for me better especially when syncing between mobile and desktop.

To upgrade, I followed the instructions available from gnucash.org, no luck
The following worked :-)
git clone https://github.com/Gnucash/gnucash
This is the older version which is 3.8. Use this script at the Wiki to upgrade to 4.9: https://wiki.gnucash.org/wiki/Building_On_Linux

Me ha gustado mucho para organizar mis finanzas personales y familiares porque permite identificar rápidamente en qué se utiliza el dinero. Eso sí, es importante tener todo muy organizado, así que prefiero crear mi propio árbol de cuentas.
summary: Muy útil. Incluso he aprendido de finanzas

description: Easy to set up accounts and add/edit entries for multiple currencies.

I have been a Quicken user for 20+ years. I am not a fan of on-line systems so I occasionally purchase an upgrade and then do not take annual updates. This time when then annual contract expired, Quicken became an "upgrade ad" where around 50% of screen space was dedicated to telling me to upgrade and the remainder was my workspace. I found GNU cash, imported my information without issue and found a fully functional, intuitive, stable and response system. I am very happy with GNU cash and hope to be using it for another 20+ years.

Been using it for years, however this current version is one of the most bugged that has been released. An example, the tax table selection is invisible though it does work. That makes it very had to do an invoice, LOL...
summary: Mostly great but some irritating bugs

description: It definitely takes some getting used to, but I have used it for tracking my finances for a couple years now and it works very well.

I had been using a *very* old version of Quicken under Windows.

Dual-booting both Windows and Linux, I thought GnuCash would be a contender as an alternative. With further use, I found its use to manage investment accounts to be limited. Recording simple investment transactions (purchasing / selling shares) is ... simple. More complicated investment transactions (e.g.: modifying cost basis) are ... complicated ... if they can be performed at all. This inadequacy may not be a deal-breaker for some users, but I was surprised to find 20+ year old software (Quicken under Wine) was more competent. Contrasting / comparing: GnuCash was a disappointment.
I switched over from Quicken. Took a bit of getting used to, but now use it exclusively.

Had no real issues using this over the last few years - a few limitations that were a frustration, like printing invoices or setting up a default styling but it wasn't getting implemented everytime I opened a report. Small issues TBH in contrast to the operation of the system. Great Work
summary: Great tool for business and personal accounting

description: I used Quicken before it went away and GnuCash was the most similar. And it has so much more that I need to explore. It was easy for me, because I have been working with computers since the first Windows 3.1 and DOS 6 and have learn how one thing or two since then.
All around best in accounting software
I have been using Gnucash for years. It is easy to figure out and wporks beautifully.

used it for years, yes it requires an understanding of basic accounting but if you dont have that then this is a perfect tool for bringing yourself up to speed. Solid and trustworthy.

Down sides, not really set up for the charity sector, but workable

I've been using GNUcash for years since Quickbooks refused to register my desktop software and demanded monthly subscriptions. You will need a basic understanding of double entry book keeping to use it but once you have learned the ropes you will love it.

I started off with some calc sheets with libreoffice. Then I looked at mobile apps like 'you need a budget'. All of these are easier to learn but then I heard so much good about this. So I tried it out. Didn't understand at first. Then I read the documentation and followed the guide. The main reason I found it hard to understand at first is that it is a double entry accounting system. This is actually the biggest strength yet turned out to be the single most important thing to understand. Like the documentation says under 'Accounting Concepts'. Try to make sure you understand that before going on. If you still don't understand and find yourself lost in the application. Go back to that. You most likely didn't get it even though you thought you did.

Once you get it this tool is absolutely amazing. The details. Incredible. The year-end reports. Amazing. Sure could they be more modern and flashy. Absolutely, but don't just wish. Make it so. Gnu cash has all the data. Make a plugin or contribute with those flashy year-end summaries and statistics generators. Think of this as your giant transaction database. As long as you fill it in you can do all kinds of amazing things in the future. You can also have your stocks listed in here with the perl plugin. I use Yahoo to get and update exchange rates automatically. That works great but that really does need quite a lot of manual work to function. It at least wasn't that plug and play for me. 

GnuCash also has a mobile app in case you need such a thing.

I don’t think it’s easy to make accounting intuitive, but GnuCash has managed to make a fairly intuitive interface with a moderately shallow learning curve. It’s reliable (I’ve been using it without problems or data loss for a decade) and contains most of the features I need.

I worry that with the rise of online-only banks with new ways of sending customers their statements, that GnuCash might get left behind. Hopefully the GnuCash developers will keep on top of that.

2020-06-20 - An excellent accounting software. However after installation on newly installed Ubuntu 20.04 (from Flatpak source), it does not start. The best it did (only once) was to bring up the startup logo and tips dialogue box, however they were unresponsive and close.
I can understand that some folks will find this software initially difficult to use. However, with a little perseverance and a noticeable amount of time you will grow to realise its potential.
summary: Very good, but it does take time to learn to use

description: Previously had to install from repos because the flatpak version was awful - extremely slow start times and crashed. This all seems to be fixed now - it runs great and starts up instantly. Big thanks to the developers.
I got that gnu cash I don't actually use this program I just like the name gnu cash lololololooln
Maybe a bit difficult to start with, but it works really well.
summary: I use it for my bookkeeping

description: I got that gnu cash I don't actually use this program I just like the name gnu cash lololololooln

Saw the early childhood rating and thought this would be the final solution that I am looking for to help my toddler finally grasp the fundamentals of accounting. I'm seriously disgustingly disappointed in his performance and lack of will to better himself, but the program is actually well made and in depth.
I use it for my home and business account management
I hope after this review, the installation begins! If so I will come back and update
Tested with Mobian. Doesn't scale to the PinePhone screen size unfortunately.
There is no posibility to disable autocomplete, this is a buggy and annoying function and makes the software unusable for me
It's free double entry accounting software that works really well and offers lots of features. Not the best, but you can't ask for more for that price.

I was using Banktivity on my Mac, but they became a subscription service. With a few hours, GNUCash is much more especially if you understand accounting principles. I now work on my finances on ANY operating system, and I have also started donating yearly to the GNUCash project. Great!
I can keep a simple record of my finances.
The app has been finally updated to a newer version, no need to git clone it now anymore!
summary: Great app, the app has been updated to 4.7 now!

description:
Been using this for a few years now. It's ability to track all your expenses, spit out reports, and connect to your bank with the online connection is amazing. The only weak spot would be the budgeting which is still quite minimal/weak. 

I like it so much I've donated and set a reminder to donate each year for its continued development.
summary: The best money manager for Linux

description: easy to use and comes with enough of the advanced features
It took me some time to learn how to use this. Also because I'm not an accounting expert. I use this for accounting of my one person business.
summary: Powerful enough for a small business

description: GnuCash helps and I've been using it for years because I couldn'f find a better option, but it doesn't compute the cash flow correctly when there are transactions between more than 2 accounts, doesn't compute automatically depreciation (you have to do most things manually inside GnuCash), doesn't accept as input some ISO standard ways to write numbers (for instance space as thousand separator), doesn't handle several users' rights (as your accountant and your cashier), doesn't output spreadsheet files etc..
summary: Helps but is very US American, and has serious flaws

description:
I'v previously been using the trial version of moneydance and i'd say that app is better for begginers. When the trial ended, i tried gnucash, imported my finances from moneydance (yes, there are issues). This is actually a powerful tool if you know how to use it. So here's the breakdown:

1. Interface is just OK, not good by any means. It looks like your standard accounting on a spreadsheet software. 

2. Functionality is there but some features like statistics and graph are hard to use, for me atleast.

3. Crossplatform support is a bonus since i have windows and mac laptops and i can sync .gnucash files with dropbox.

I would give it a five star if the interface was better.

I don't do any Flatpak or etc!

Pure RPM well tested, safe and secure is prefered - ALWAYS!

It really helps me to manage my personal finance. It's very easy to use and although I am still learning the report generation functionality at first sight I can see there a lot more functionality that can play in my favor.

GnuCash works, but is very US-centered and several annoying mistakes are never corrected. GnuCash doesn't calculate cash flow correctly in case of multi-account transactions because one of the developpers' friend said to him something contrary to the IFRS (and to the very notion of cash flow). It's impossible to copy and cut a number in ISO format into GnuCash (with a space as thousand separator). If you're in an environnement were a dot is used as decimal separator but you've recorded scheduled transactions with a comma, then your decimals are just ignored. etc..
summary: Works but mistakes hasn't been corrected for years

description: Gnucash is a great tool for small businesses but it does take time to learn the complex transactions properly.  There are also still aspects of it that need improving and a few that do not work for everyone. However in all I thoroughly recommended it, especially if you only need to record basic transactions.
summary: Worth learning how to use it

description: Bis jetzt ist noch nichts gscheiteres nachgekommen.
Leider ein K. O.-Kriterium für ein Banking-Programm. Ist mir bis jetzt auch noch nicht untergekommen.
summary: Datenbank lässt sich nicht durch ein Passwort schützen?

description: als offline-Konto kann man es gut gebrauchen
summary: Konto onlinefähig zu machen klappt nicht

description: Ich benutzte GnuCash schon seit Jahren und finde die Auswertungen, das Kontobuch, die Handhabung sehr effizient und ausgereift. Toll, dass es solch eine freie Software gibt!
Ich finde das Programm gut, Datenbank läßt sich verschlüsseln, sofern man SQL benutzt, ist netzwerkfähig, mir fehlt allerdings im Geschäftsbereich die Möglichkeit Angebote zu erstellen.
summary: Für Buchhaltung nach SKR03 zu gebrauchen

description:
gnucash kann scheint's eine ganze Menge... mehr als ich brauche. Mir persönlich(!!) ist schon der Einstieg zu schwer gefallen, um mich längere Zeit mit den Vorzügen und Fähigkeiten des Programms auseinandersetzen zu wollen. Liegt sicherlich auch daran, dass ich mit betriebswirtschaftlicher Buchführung nicht sonderlich vertraut bin und auch nicht zuerst die Dokumentation gelesen habe.
Für meine bescheidenen Anforderungen reichen zunächst noch meine selbstgebastelten Tabellen (inkl. enthaltener Auswertungen).
Ich benutze GnuCash seit jahren für meine private und berufliche Tätigkeit. Nun habe ich eine GmbH gegründet und auch zu diesem Zweck erfüllt es alles, was es soll. Super!

the Snap is missing the libdbd library (is needed by using sqlite storing). This Lib isn't installed default in 22.04
Solve the problem width: apt install libdbd-sqlite3
But is better the author of the GnuCash SNAP is solving the problem

If the App is running, it's a great one.
Als Laie benutze ich es seit Jahren für meine privaten Finanzen. Perfekt für meine Ansprüche.
I'm to stupid to use it
summary: I'm to stupid to use it

description: Leider startete die Anwendung nach der Installation nicht. Auch ein Neustart brachte keine Besserung.
summary: Läuft nicht unter Fedora 32 X Window

description: Läuft soweit gut auf Ubuntu 20.10
Keeps track of all my money-related stuff. Need to learn a lot at the start, but then it works better than anything else.
Lo he utilizado en cada distro que he usado, y ahora en Fedora también. Lo uso para mis finanzas personales y para mi trabajo. Funciona perfecto.

Sin duda alguna, una solución completa para hogar y oficina, potente y bastante flexible, por supuesto tomara tiempo adaptarse o aprenderlo, pero una vez que lo entiendes, no te querras cambiar. Usuario desde 2001.
Perfecta para finanzas personales o empresas pequenias.

Para finanzas personales, perfecto!!
!Si no me creen, preguntente a mi casero.....XD XD
buena aplicacion de finanzas
Llevo usándola desde hace más de quince años y estoy muy contento con el resultado obtenido.
summary: Es la mejor aplicación que he visto para una contabilidad privada

description:
además de poder practicar asientos y llevarla en el celular, se pueden hacer informes interesantes
la recomiendo para todas las escuelas comerciales
summary: es muy útil en la escuela para ver la contabilidad en su conjunto

description: El mejor software para contabilidad personal. Lo uso siempre.
Me parece una aplicación excelente, la use durante un tiempo pero tiendo a ser un poco dejado.

je suis GnuCash depuis le début. Sérieux et solide, je l'en suis servit pour mes comptes perso et pour gérér un copropriété.
À l'époque, la personnalisation des rapports était un peu ardue et nécessitait de coder en lisp... Je n'ai pas encore regardé où ça en est.

je recommande vivement ce logiciel de comptabilité, 
je l'utilise pour mes finances quotidiennes, 
et aussi pour mes projets en batiments,

Franchement, pour une application gratuite, rien à redire (il faut bien sur avoir quelques notions comptable pour l'utiliser).
Comptabilité en partie double, rapprochement, budget, reporting, ... et tout cela paramétrable avec le jeu de comptes qu'on désire !

Faut investir un peu de temps, mais ça vaut vraiment le coût !

Подробные сообщения об ошибках от менеджера пакетов:

gnucash-2.6.18-1.el7.x86_64 требуется libguile-2.0.so.22()(64bit)
gnucash-2.6.18-1.el7.x86_64 требуется libguile-2.0.so.22(GUILE_2.0)(64bit)
aqbanking-5.5.1-1.el7.x86_64 требуется libxmlsec1-gnutls.so.1()(64bit)
aqbanking-5.5.1-1.el7.x86_64 требуется libxmlsec1-gcrypt.so.1()(64bit)

Подойдет для любого, мало- мальски разбирающегося в бухгалтерии.
Под windows подобные программы стоят дорого и хуже. Юрий.

Опробовал все доступные приложения по ведению домашней бухгалтерии и учёта инвестиций - GnuCash оказалась на мой взгляд наиболее продвинутой из всех. В добавок проект продолжает развиваться. Для вхождения нужен опыт и начальные знания. Мне зашло раза с третьего - до этого пришлось потренироваться на более простых приложениях. Но в конечном счёте более чем доволен полнотой функционала GnuCash.
Большей функционал и неплохой дизайн
очень хорошо зделали!
Отвратительное приложение. Абсолютно не подходящее для работы бухгалтера
отличное приложения для личных финансов
Просто и эффективно. Пользуюсь.
如果能像中国的会计软件处理交易的流程那样，从交易事项入手，以记账凭证录入来记录交易，而不是直接编辑会计科目（账户）则更好。还有就是账务报表的编制如果能自定义格式和公式，就更好！真心希望越来越好！
